labels.name: status/can-merge
labels.description: Status: Can merge to base branch

labels.name: needs-cherry-pick-release-5.4
labels.description: Type: Need cherry pick to release-5.4

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you for contributing to TiKV!

If you haven't already, please read TiKV's [CONTRIBUTING](https://github.com/tikv/tikv/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) document.

If you're unsure about anything, just ask; somebody should be along to answer within a day or two.

PR Title Format:
1. module [, module2, module3]: what's changed
2. *: what's changed
-->

### What is changed and how it works?
<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://github.com/tikv/tikv/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#linking-issues.

-->
Issue Number: Ref #11187

What's Changed:

<!--

You could use "commit message" code block to add more description to the final commit message.
For more info, check https://github.com/tikv/tikv/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#format-of-the-commit-message.

-->
```commit-message
```

### Related changes

- Requires:
  - https://github.com/tikv/tikv/pull/15747
  - https://github.com/tikv/tikv/pull/15749

- PR to update `pingcap/docs`/`pingcap/docs-cn`:

### Check List <!--REMOVE the items that are not applicable-->

Tests <!-- At least one of them must be included. -->

- Unit test
- Integration test
- Manual test (add detailed scripts or steps below)
- No code

Side effects

- Performance regression
    - Consumes more CPU
    - Consumes more MEM
- Breaking backward compatibility

### Release note <!-- bugfixes or new feature need a release note -->

```release-note
Fix the problem that in environments that network is very unstable, if a prewrite request is retried ant the TiKV recieves the retried request before the original request, it's possible to lead to transactoin correctness issue.
```

comment.body: /test

@MyonKeminta: Your PR was out of date, I have automatically updated it for you.

If the CI test fails, you just re-trigger the test that failed and the bot will merge the PR for you after the CI passes.


<details>

Instructions for interacting with me using PR comments are available [here](https://prow.tidb.net/command-help).  If you have questions or suggestions related to my behavior, please file an issue against the [ti-community-infra/tichi](https://github.com/ti-community-infra/tichi/issues/new?title=Prow%20issue:) repository.
</details>

comment.body:
@MyonKeminta: It seems you want to merge this PR, I will help you trigger all the tests:

/run-all-tests

You only need to trigger `/merge` once, and if the CI test fails, you just re-trigger the test that failed and the bot will merge the PR for you after the CI passes.

> If you have any questions about the PR merge process, please refer to [pr process](https://book.prow.tidb.net/#/en/workflows/pr).

issue.title: tikv's worker pending tasks under task result is not correct

labels.name: type/bug
labels.description: Type: Issue - Confirmed a bug

issue.body:
## Bug Report

<!-- Thanks for your bug report! Don't worry if you can't fill out all the sections. -->

### What version of TiKV are you using?
<!-- You can run `tikv-server --version` -->
nightly

### What operating system and CPU are you using?
<!-- If you're using Linux, you can run `cat /proc/cpuinfo` -->

### Steps to reproduce
<!-- If possible, provide a recipe for reproducing the error. A complete runnable program is good. -->
The current expression is "sum(rate(tikv_futurepool_pending_task_total{k8s_cluster=\"$k8s_cluster\", tidb_cluster=\"$tidb_cluster\", instance=~\"$instance\", name=~\"sched-worker-.*\"}[1m]))" but `tikv_futurepool_pending_task_total` is gauge, do rate on gauge is not correct.

### What did you expect?

### What did happened?

commits.message:
metrics: fix 2 incorrect grafana expression (#15860)

close tikv/tikv#15859

Signed-off-by: glorv <glorvs@163.com>

Co-authored-by: ti-chi-bot[bot] <108142056+ti-chi-bot[bot]@users.noreply.github.com>

pull_request.title: metrics: fix 2 incorrect grafana expression
pull_request.body: ### What is changed and how it works? Issue Number: Close #15859 What's Changed: ``` - Fix the incorrect expression on `tikv_futurepool_pending_task_total ` by changing the aggregation function from `rate` to `avg_over_time` - Fix grafana relate to `tikv_coprocessor_request_wait_seconds_bucket` by add "type=all" ``` Result: before this change, when running oltp_write_only with 50 threads on a 8c tikv: after this change: ### Related changes - PR to update `pingcap/docs`/`pingcap/docs-cn`: - Need to cherry-pick to the release branch ### Check List Tests - No code Side effects ### Release note ```release-note None ```

labels.name: status/LGT2
labels.description: Status: PR - There are already 2 approvals

labels.name: status/can-merge
labels.description: Status: Can merge to base branch

issue.title: metrics: fix 2 incorrect grafana expression

labels.name: status/LGT2
labels.description: Status: PR - There are already 2 approvals

labels.name: status/can-merge
labels.description: Status: Can merge to base branch

issue.body: ### What is changed and how it works? Issue Number: Close #15859 What's Changed: ``` - Fix the incorrect expression on `tikv_futurepool_pending_task_total ` by changing the aggregation function from `rate` to `avg_over_time` - Fix grafana relate to `tikv_coprocessor_request_wait_seconds_bucket` by add "type=all" ``` Result: before this change, when running oltp_write_only with 50 threads on a 8c tikv: after this change: ### Related changes - PR to update `pingcap/docs`/`pingcap/docs-cn`: - Need to cherry-pick to the release branch ### Check List Tests - No code Side effects ### Release note ```release-note None ```

comment.body: /test

pull_request.title: metrics: fix TiKV Detail command regex escape issue
pull_request.body:
<!--
Thank you for contributing to TiKV!

If you haven't already, please read TiKV's [CONTRIBUTING](https://github.com/tikv/tikv/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) document.

If you're unsure about anything, just ask; somebody should be along to answer within a day or two.

<!--

Please create an issue first to describe the problem.

There MUST be one line starting with "Issue Number:  " and 
linking the relevant issues via the "close" or "ref".

For more info, check https://github.com/tikv/tikv/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#linking-issues.

-->

Touch #15833

As title, "\b" should be escaped as "\\\\b".

issue.title: metrics: fix futurepool pending tasks

labels.name: status/LGT2
labels.description: Status: PR - There are already 2 approvals

issue.body: ### What is changed and how it works? Issue Number: Close #15859 What's Changed: ``` - Fix the incorrect expression on `tikv_futurepool_pending_task_total ` by changing the aggregation function from `rate` to `avg_over_time` - Fix grafana relate to `tikv_coprocessor_request_wait_seconds_bucket` by add "type=all" ``` Result: before this change, when running oltp_write_only with 50 threads on a 8c tikv: after this change: ### Related changes - PR to update `pingcap/docs`/`pingcap/docs-cn`: - Need to cherry-pick to the release branch ### Check List Tests - No code Side effects ### Release note ```release-note None ```

comment.body:
@Connor1996: It seems you want to merge this PR, I will help you trigger all the tests:

/run-all-tests

You only need to trigger `/merge` once, and if the CI test fails, you just re-trigger the test that failed and the bot will merge the PR for you after the CI passes.

> If you have any questions about the PR merge process, please refer to [pr process](https://book.prow.tidb.net/#/en/workflows/pr).


<details>

Instructions for interacting with me using PR comments are available [here](https://prow.tidb.net/command-help).  If you have questions or suggestions related to my behavior, please file an issue against the [ti-community-infra/tichi](https://github.com/ti-community-infra/tichi/issues/new?title=Prow%20issue:) repository.
</details>
